Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.plugins.dipc.interfaces

Interface PushControlCI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentInterface, OfferedCI, PushControlImplementationI, java.rmi.Remote, RequiredCI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PushControlConnector, PushControlInboundPort, PushControlOutboundPort
    public interface PushControlCI
extends PushControlImplementationI, OfferedCI, RequiredCI
    The interface PushingControlCI proposes basic component services to control the regular exchanges of data via a DataOfferedCI interface in push mode.

    Description

    The interface simply adds to PushControlImplementationI the OfferedCI and RequiredCI to make it a component interface.

    Nota: since Java 8, Oracle jdk release 241, methods inherited by a remote interface are no longer considered remote if the inherited interface is not itself remote; to bypass this, methods must be redefined in the remote method. Marking them with @Override stresses the design objective to share identical signatures between the implementation interface and the component interface.

    Created on : 2018-01-26

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      boolean currentlyPushesData​(java.lang.String portURI)

      boolean isPortExisting​(java.lang.String portURI)
      return true if the owner component has a data offered inbound port of the given URI.
      void startLimitedPushing​(java.lang.String portURI, long interval, int n)
      start, after interval period of time, n pushes of data and force the pushes to be done each interval period of time.
      void startUnlimitedPushing​(java.lang.String portURI, long interval)
      start, after interval period of time, the pushing of data and force the pushes to be done indefinitely each interval period of time.
      void stopPushing​(java.lang.String portURI)
      stop the pushing of data on the given port.
